greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of solutions to x^9 + y^9 = z^9 mod n.
comment: Equivalently, the number of solutions to x^9 + y^9 + z^9 == 0 (mod n). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 17 2018
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms 1..1000 from Seiichi Manyama)
mathematica: Table[cnt=0; Do[If[Mod[x^9 + y^9 - z^9, n]==0, cnt++], {x, 0, n-1}, {y, 0, n-1}, {z, 0, n-1}]; cnt, {n, 50}] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 18 2018 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)={my(p=Mod(sum(i=0, n-1, x^lift(Mod(i,n)^9)), 1-x^n)); polcoeff(lift(p^3), 0)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Jul 17 2018
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Jun 05 2017
